column4: hi, I'm wondering where the file is that defines which services are to start/run?
hi, I'm wondering where the file is that defines which services are to start/run?
Are you wanting to clean up the boot process?
yea, just stop unwanted services from running...things like apache2, but not that
Give me a moment while I find that bookmark lol
oh, great... thanks  I was thinking /etc/init.d as that is what you call to start/stop stuff.. but looking at the file.. I don't know
init.d is what spawns the processes yes, but rc.d calls it at boot-time.
oh, great... thanks. Going to have a look
One sec. I believe you can just do an update-rc.d remove <name> but let me see.
When I did what you are trying to a few weeks ago I did `sudo update-rc.d -f <name of boot item to remove> remove`
ah, thanks.. this method is better than stopping the service and commenting out the config file :P
If not, read this thread. You do not have to install the bootcharts, just follow it. http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=89491
great. I'll take note of it and check it out when I'm back to my GUI
Yes, that link is very helpful lol. Maybe not in lynx tho haha. But good luck :)
